data.title: Provide API to return formatted content from suggest and parameter hints
data.body:
Take the following snippet:

`````` typescript
/**
 * Some documentation is **nice**.
 * 
 * Example usage:
 * 
 * ```
 * function main() {
 *   return hello('world');
 * }
 * ```
 */
function hello(world: string): number {
    return 1337;
}
``````

Here's how it looks in different widgets:

**Hover**

![foo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/18433520/58036fe6-78e8-11e6-95d0-b8e831dde2f9.png)

**Suggest**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/18433537/6ef1a6f0-78e8-11e6-953b-f7259b9f88c5.png)

**Parameter hints**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/18433543/768b1a5e-78e8-11e6-9988-1b6379112fe5.png)
## 

Widgets look now somewhat aligned, since #2330. Their contents, on the other hand, could be a bit more.

Hover looks great, since at some point we provided the possibility of returning `MarkedString` through the API.

Both suggest and parameter hints lack that and look pretty pale in comparison.

We got to find a way to advance the API allowing users to return formatted content from certain API calls without bloating the API too much.

data.title: VS Code tries to read 'range' field from TextEdit which is null
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.1 (07d663dc1bd848161edf4cd4ce30cce410d3d877, 2016-09-08T21:34:58.760Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.7.2-201.fc24.x86_64

Steps to Reproduce:

After sending CompletionItem[] as a response for 'textDocument/completion' nothing is happening, no proposals. Developer tools console shows error.

Response for method: 'textDocument/completion':

```
Content-Type: application/vscode-jsonrpc; charset=utf8
Content-Length: 187

{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":[{"label":"abstract","kind":14,"detail":null,"documentation":null,"sortText":null,"filterText":null,"insertText":"abstract","textEdit":null,"data":null}]}
```

Developer tools console shows:

```
//usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:121 Cannot read property 'range' of null: TypeError: Cannot read property 'range' of null
    at asTextEdit (/home/wywrzal/git/vscode-php-intellisense/node_modules/vscode-languageclient/lib/protocolConverter.js:100:46)
    at /home/wywrzal/git/vscode-php-intellisense/node_modules/vscode-languageclient/lib/protocolConverter.js:95:67
    at set (/home/wywrzal/git/vscode-php-intellisense/node_modules/vscode-languageclient/lib/protocolConverter.js:83:13)
    at asCompletionItem (/home/wywrzal/git/vscode-php-intellisense/node_modules/vscode-languageclient/lib/protocolConverter.js:95:9)
    at Array.map (native)
    at asCompletionResult (/home/wywrzal/git/vscode-php-intellisense/node_modules/vscode-languageclient/lib/protocolConverter.js:76:26)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:103:7)
```

data.title: Ctrl + Click to Go To Definition
data.body: Feature request; when holding CRTL and clicking on a method, variable etc. jumps to the method definition. Just like the feature in Productivity Power Tools 2015 for Visual Studio

data.title: Inconsistent Toggling
data.body:
Ctrl+F doesn't toggle. Ctrl+H doesn't toggle. Ctrl+Shift+H doesn't toggle.

Why does Ctrl+Shift+F toggle?

Ctrl+F and Ctrl+H will switch from one to the other.

The same is not true for Ctrl+Shift+F and Ctrl+Shift+H.

Can you give me an option in settings to fix this?

I want to disable all toggling between the text editor and the find box. Ctrl+Shift+F should never move me to the text editor.

Ctrl+Shift+F and Ctrl+Shift+H should switch between one another.

data.title: Enable "Open with Code" on drive roots in Windows Explorer
data.body:
The Windows Explorer context menu "Open with Code" works with files and directories but not with drive roots (C:\, D:\, etc.).
This change in the registry fixes that.

data.title: Invalid keyboard bindings file causes editor to not load
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro build 14393.105

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Overwrite everything in your keyboard bindings file with this (i.e. without the array brackets):
   {"key": "ctrl+shift+alt+F", "command": "stylefmt", "when": "editorTextFocus"}
2. Try to open VS code - the editor fails to load and you end up with a blank window.

Expected outcome: The editor should still load and I should be informed that my keyboard bindings are invalid and have been ignored.

data.title: WinSCP open files in VSCode but don't show VSCode window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.1 (07d663dc1bd848161edf4cd4ce30cce410d3d877, 2016-09-08T21:33:49.307Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Define VSCode as default WinSCP editor
2. Open any file from WinSCP - file is opened and VSCode window is displayed
3. Keep VSCode open and open another file from WinSCP - file is opened but VSCode window is not displayed (stays in background, WinSCP remain the opened window).

I've checked issues #159 and #167 but can't fix this problem.

Romain

data.title: Synchronize dirty files across multiple windows

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file
2. Create a new window
3. Drag the file to the second window (opens a second copy)

Is there any plans to have a "live sync" when a file is opened in two windows at the same time? Right now the second window only gets updated when one saves. It is very easy to accidentally start editing an out of date version of the file.

Editors such as sublime fully support this and I was expecting the same behavior.

data.title: Quitting Code in fullscreen mode forgets previous windows state
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. move and size the window to some specific state 
2. restart and verify this state is restored
3. put window into fullscreen and quit from fullscreen
4. restart
   => the window is put back to its default window state

Expected: restore the window to the size it was having from previous sessions

data.title: VSCode Marketplace site does not support internal links in Readme markdown
data.body:
(This isn't a problem with VSCode itself, however I couldn't find a better place to file this)

When VSCode Marketplace site renders readme for a published extension, it ignores internal (aka intra-document) links.  For example, consider the document below; the table of contents links to sections work correctly in the internal VSCode viewer, however on the Marketplace site they all just open a new copy of the page.  

``` markdown
Table of contents:
[Section 1](#section-1)
[Section 2](#section-2)
...

# Section 1
...

# Section 2
...
```

data.title: VS freezing every five minutes on CSS file
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

My VS Code freezes on my computer every five minutes when working with larger CSS file (~100kb). Only way to resolve this is to run Windows Task Manager, kill whole VSC and then start again. This bug unfortunately makes VSC for me unusable, as it highly frustrates me having to restart my editor every 5 minutes, lose last position, recent changes in file etc. Might I help by providing some kind of log? Pleas give me instructions to help you if possible.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open CSS file of approc 100 kb in VSC
2. Keep working for about 5 minutes. Then VSC totally freezes. Cursor stops at position, window does not respond to any kind of input.

Yes, VSC after another 2 minutes show dialog "Keep waiting/reopen." However no matter which option I select, the apps keep being frozen. "Reopen button" only hides the dialog but does not restart the app. Has to be done throught Windows Task manager.

Note: the menu bar is responding when application is frozen. Only the editor part does not respond and cursor is stuck.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6624752/18427772/84138292-78ca-11e6-8541-6907cc624236.png)

data.title: Installing extensions in Linux through authenticated proxy fails (Server returned 407)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Debian 8.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have proxy which requires authentication (in my case simple auth)
2. Add proxy server to user settings:
   "http.proxy": "http://username:password@proxy1.domain.com:80", 
3. Optionally also setup proxy in env: 
   export http_proxy=http://username:password@proxy1.domain.com:80
4. Run vscode and display extensions - extensions are displayed with option to install
5. Click on install (any extension) - Error - Server returned 407

data.title: Add optional timeout to MessageBox (Information, Error, Warning)
data.body:
Just simply an optional timeout in milliseconds that can be specified to make a messagebox dismiss itself after that amount of time.

Alternatively provide a way of dismissing message boxes manually so that one might do this with `setTimeout`.

data.title: Bracket matching does not work as expected if the opening brace symbol is contained in the closing brace symbol (e.g. sequence endsequence)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add custom bracket definitions as shown

``` json
{
    "comments": {
        // symbol used for single line comment. Remove this entry if your language does not support line comments
        "lineComment": "//",
        // symbols used for start and end a block comment. Remove this entry if your language does not support block comments
        "blockComment": [ "/*", "*/" ]
    },
    // symbols used as brackets
    "brackets": [
        ["(*", "*)"],       
        ["[*", "*]"],
        ["{", "}"],
        ["[", "]"],
        ["(", ")"],
        ["sequence", "endsequence"],
        ["feature", "endfeature"]   
    ],
    // symbols that are auto closed when typing
    "autoClosingPairs": [
        ["(*", "*)"],       
        ["[*", "*]"],
        ["{", "}"],
        ["\"", "\""],
        ["'", "'"],
        ["sequence", "endsequence"],
        ["feature", "endfeature"]  
    ],
    // symbols that that can be used to surround a selection
    "surroundingPairs": [
        ["(*", "*)"],       
        ["[*", "*]"],
        ["{", "}"],
        ["[", "]"],
        ["(", ")"],
        ["\"", "\""],
        ["'", "'"],
        ["sequence", "endsequence"],
        ["feature", "endfeature"]  
    ]
}
```
1.  Brace matching (Control+Shift+) for nested sequence blocks does not work as expected. For the following text: 

```
sequence "outer"
     sequence "inner"
     endsequence
endsequence
```

A brace match command on the outer endsequence, mistakenly selects the sequence text in the inner endsequence.

data.title: Enable c# object dump in debugger console from code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install c# extension
2. Create .net core application
3. Write complex object to console
   1. `Console.WriteLine(new Dictionary<string, string>{{"foo", "bar"}});`
   2. `Debug.WriteLine(new Dictionary<string, string>{{"foo", "bar"}});`
   3.  `Console.WriteLine(Newtonsoft.Json.JsonConvert.SerializeObject(new Dictionary<string, string>{{"foo", "bar"}}));`
4. Run program
5. Inspect debugger console

Result:
1. Debugger console contains string representation of the object:  
   
   System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[System.String,System.String]
   
   or
   
   {"foo":"bar"}

Expected result:
1. Debugger console contains object which can be interacted with. Same as if `new Dictionary<string, string>{{"foo", "bar"}}` would be executed in debugger console:
   
   Count = 1
   [0] [KeyValuePair]:{[foo, bar]}
   Raw View

Notes:

LinqPad has extension method called Dump. It allows to render complex objects in form of tables. It would be great to have something similar in vs code. Yes, I can put breakpoint and manually dump object. But I want to be able to do that from code. So I can re-run program and instantly see complex object in debugger log. Don't really care what would be the method to dump objects.

data.title: Find Replace, match previous case

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
While doing a search and replace:  If I don't have match case selected, could the find and replace, replace the appropriate words based on their previous case?

example:  I have several references to "HomeComponent", "HomeService", "homeService", "homeModel", "homeRef", etc.

If I want to change the word "Home" to "Portal", why can't I just add the word "portal" in the replace input and it automatically change all the above to:
"PortalComponent", "PortalService", "portalService", "portalModel", "portalRef", etc ???

Nobody should complain about this new functionality because you clearly don't care about case when you have "Match Case" unselected!

data.title: Question: How does one make a custom tab view (something like preview markdown)
data.body:
I have a couple of extension ideas and apps that I want to port to vscode and I need this. By this I mean: For example I wanna make a dependency-graph view for the typescript like the one in Atom: 

![68747470733a2f2f7261772e67697468756275736572636f6e74656e742e636f6d2f547970655374726f6e672f61746f6d2d747970657363726970742d6578616d706c65732f6d61737465722f73637265656e732f646570656e64656e6379566965772f7465617365722e706e67](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2157285/18421070/19ad03b2-7896-11e6-82f7-a431e4ea11ca.png)
![68747470733a2f2f7261772e67697468756275736572636f6e74656e742e636f6d2f547970655374726f6e672f61746f6d2d747970657363726970742d6578616d706c65732f6d61737465722f73637265656e732f61737446756c6c2e706e67](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2157285/18421072/1a0ac7f4-7896-11e6-845c-e262b5066541.png)

Or far example I have a custom visual language based on Blockly so I can't use the monaco environment but I also wanted to have it in vscode around my other tools. How can I make it? I found no good documentations or sample codes for that. 

Also another question is that how can I open this "custom-view" for a certain format instead of the monaco?

Thanks for all you kind answers as always.

data.title: Embedded language support in Markdown
data.body:
I'm developing an [extension](https://github.com/vstirbu/vscode-mermaid-preview) that enables preview of [mermaid diagrams](http://knsv.github.io/mermaid/) inside Visual Studio Code. My workflow assumes that the mermaid diagrams are embedded as github fenced code blocks inside Markdown documents: 
# Markdown document

next is a mermaid sequence diagram...

```mermaid
%% Example of sequence diagram
sequenceDiagram
    Alice->>John: Hello John, how are you?
    John-->>Alice: Great!
```
I would like to provide a `mermaid` language extension for the content inside the fenced block but the extension sees the document as `markdown`. The extension docs are not that useful for this situation. What is the proper way to handle the embedded language with an extension?

data.title: Investigate better synchronization between diagnostic request and auot code complete
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5
- OS Version: all

VS Code currently requests diagnostics after 100 ms after the last typing. This seems to be too eager and especially conflicts with auto code complete. If a diagnostic request is trigger on very larger files it can take up to 1 second which delays auto code complete for a second. We should better sync this (e.g make sure we sent the auto code complete request always before a diagnostic request)

data.title: Alt-H2 Preview and Syntax Highlighting Issues
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro Insider Preview: Build 14915

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new markdown file
2. Apply dash line under desired text

```
My Header
---------
```

Preview renders the font size correctly, but does not display a solid line under the text. Also the dashes ( - ) do not get highlighted via the Markdown syntax highlighting.

```
My Header
=========
```

The above works as it should.

data.title: Expose an API to launch a url in browser
data.body:
VSCode uses `shell.openExternal` from `electron` to launch urls in the browser. There are some places I'd like to do the same but it seems doing it manually requires platform-specific code (or another third party package to hide that).

Is it possible vscode could provide a wrapper for eletron's `shell.openExternal`? Taking a dependency on Electron directly seems crazy (if it'd even work) because we'd have to manually keep the version in sync with VSCode (not to mention it's a lot of API to pull in for one method).
